info.title: Transferwise API
info.notes:
###Using the TransferWise API
There are several key resource when using the TransferWise API.  The starting point in creating a transfer is generating a **quote**, a quote is a persistent object that represents TransferWise's offer to the customer.  

Depending on currency route and the amount to be transferred we may be able to offer either a fixed rate quote or a variable rate quote.  Quotes will have some kind of expiry criteria indicating the conditions under which they are valid.  

A quote also allows you to query the available **pay-in-methods** (e.g. card, bank transfer etc) with their associated **fees**, and the information we will need the user to provide, either by updating their **user** record or by submitting verification **documents**. 

You can use a quote to create a **transfer**, a transfer indicates the customer wishes to accept the quote and will pay in the required amount of money. At this stage no money has been paid, but as we are able to receive **payments** these will become visible against that transfer.

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description: Optional value to reference earlier versions of the API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The response format, defaults to JSON.

parameters.name: jsonp
parameters.description: Indicates the server should respond in JSONP format, the value should be the name of the callback.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Some browsers do not support certain HTTP methods (e.g. PUT, PATCH and DELETE), this optional parameter enables you to use a POST request but ask the server to treat the request as a PUT, PATCH or DELETE.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: For paged requests, specifies the offset from the first row in the collection to the first row returned, default 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: For paged requests, specifies the max number of rows to return, default is 20.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: For paged requests, specifies whether to reverse the sort order, default is 'asc'.

parameters.description: The account receiving the funds.

parameters.description: The account which is sending the funds and into which any refunds should be paid.

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: The payment reference as given by a payment processing partner.

parameters.description: The pay in method

parameters.name: transferRequestId
parameters.description: If the transfer is related to a transfer request, specify the id, this is the only way to update that the transfer request has been paid, it will automatically update as soon as the transfer completes.

apis.description: Get exchange rates.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source currency, iso4217 3-digit currency code.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: The target currency, iso4217 3-digit currency code.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount to be transferred.

parameters.name: amountType
parameters.description: (Optional) Is it the amount for source currency or target currency?  Defaults to source.

parameters.name: rateTolerance
parameters.description: (Optional) The percentage movement before the quote would become invalid e.g. a value of 3 would mean the rate could deteriate by 3% until the quote became invalid and the transfer was paused.If the rate falls below this limit the quote would become invalid.  Default is 3%.

parameters.name: businessId
parameters.description: (Optional) If this quote is for a business supply the business id.  If you do not supply a business id you will not be able to create a transfer for business account using this quote.

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description: Optional value to reference earlier versions of the API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The response format, defaults to JSON.

parameters.name: jsonp
parameters.description: Indicates the server should respond in JSONP format, the value should be the name of the callback.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Some browsers do not support certain HTTP methods (e.g. PUT, PATCH and DELETE), this optional parameter enables you to use a POST request but ask the server to treat the request as a PUT, PATCH or DELETE.

parameters.description: Optional value to reference earlier versions of the API.

operations.summary: This endpoint provides information about the current user.
operations.notes: If the user is not logged in this endpoint may still be used but will provide only very minimal information, like a default country/currency.

apis.description: This endpoint provides information about the current user.

name.name: name
name.description: A short name for the error message

message.name: message
message.description: A human readable and client friendly error message
message.example: The API method does not exist

transfer.name: transfer

user.name: user
user.description: The user who initiated the transfer.

sendingAccount.name: sendingAccount
sendingAccount.description: The account which is sending the funds and into which any refunds should be paid.

reference.name: reference
reference.description: The payment reference as given by a payment processing partner.

rate.name: rate
rate.description: The rate at which the transfer occured.

createdTime.name: createdTime
createdTime.description: The date at which this transfer was created.

createdByUser.name: createdByUser
createdByUser.description: The user whoe created this transfer.

transferRequestId.name: transferRequestId
transferRequestId.description: If the transfer is related to a transfer request, specify the id, this is the only way to update that the transfer request has been paid, it will automatically update as soon as the transfer completes.

transfer.notes:
Transfers are the key resource when working with TransferWise, they describe the end-to-end process of registering the intent to transfer funds, performing payments into the TransferWise platform, the exchange of funds, and the pay out to the receiving account.  

A transfer is initiated by a user, that user may be both the sender and receiver, or they may be sending or receiving money funds from an account owned by another user.  However, the user must own at least one of the accounts involved (sending or receiving). 

If the other account is new and is not owned by the current user it needs to be linked to an unregistered user.

user.name: user

info.name: info
info.description: Key/value information about the user.  The required keys can be fethced from the user-requirements endpoint.

defaultCountry.name: defaultCountry
defaultCountry.description: The default country for this user.

user.notes: The user account.  User have a profile which may contain various information depending on the country and payment methods the user uses.

user-required.name: user-required

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this data, this key is used to update the associated profile.

name.name: name
name.description: A localise name for this property

description.name: description
description.description: A localised description of the property

regex.name: regex
regex.description: A regular expression that the value must satisfy.  Only for text and number types.

user-required.notes:
Required verifications are pieces of information that we need added to the users profile to be able to create a transfer using their chosen quote (route, amount, payment method).  This may be additional information like a users address, or it may be a document that we need to prove the users identity.

REQUIRES FURTHER CONSIDERATION.

profile.name: profile

address1.name: address1
address1.description: The first line of the address.

address2.name: address2
address2.description: The second line of the address.

verifications.name: verifications
verifications.description: The list of verification data associated with this profile.

profile.notes: Profiles are specific representations of users, a single user may have multiple profiles, for example a business and a personal profile.

payment.name: payment

amount.name: amount
amount.description: The amount of money moved in the payment.

type.name: type
type.description: To the type of payment, either a payIn to transferwise, or a payout from transferwise.

account.name: account
account.description: The customer account where the money came from, or where the money went.

currency.name: currency
currency.description: The currency use for this payment, iso4217 3-digit currency code.

payment.notes:
Payments resources represent the specific movements of funds between accounts.  A single transfer may involve several payments, for example the payment of funds from the sender to TransferWise, and the payment from TransferWise to the recipient account.

Occasionally a sender may pay in the incorrect amount and may have to make a second payment between the same two accounts, this would become a second payment resource rather than an amendment to the first payment.

account.name: account

businessId.name: businessId
businessId.description: An optional businessId, used if this account is owned by a business rather than the currenct user.

accountHolderName.name: accountHolderName
accountHolderName.description: The name of the account holder.

currency.name: currency
currency.description: The currency used by the account, , iso4217 3-digit currency code.

info.name: info
info.description: Key/value information about this account, the required keys for each account type/country/currency can be retrieved from the account-requirements endpoint.

createdByUser.name: createdByUser
createdByUser.description: The user who created this account.

account.notes: Accounts are holders of value, they can pay out or receive funds.  There may be a number of different types of accounts depending on country, or other factors.  Depending on the type of account extra information will be included/required specific to that account type.

verification.name: verification

profileId.name: profileId
profileId.description: The profile asscoiated with this document

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this data, this key is used to update the associated profile.

verification.notes:
A verification is a document required to verify information about the user.  We will often need additional data about a user to be able to create or complete transfers.  Documents may require manual checking, the status property will indicate where we are in this process.

REQUIRES FURTHER CONSIDERATION.

verification-required.name: verification-required

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this data, this key is used to update the associated profile.

name.name: name
name.description: A localised name for the required document.

description.name: description
description.description: A localised description of this verification.

reason.name: reason
reason.description: A localised reason for why we need the user to upload this information.
reason.example: We need a copy of your passport to verify your identity.

alternatives.name: alternatives
alternatives.description: An alternative key in this group that can be supplied instead of this key.

requiredBeforeCreation.name: requiredBeforeCreation
requiredBeforeCreation.description: Is this information required before we create a transfer

verification-required.notes: To ensure compliance with all local regulations we often need to ask our users to provide verification documents and information, verification-required resources explain the documents we require to be able to create a transfer.

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this group of fields

alternatives.name: alternatives
alternatives.description: The keys of alternative groups that could be completed instead of this group.

name.name: name
name.description: A localised name for the group of fields

field-required.name: field-required

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this data, this key is used to update the associated profile.

name.name: name
name.description: A localise name for this property

description.name: description
description.description: A localised description of the property

regexp.name: regexp
regexp.description: A regular expression that the value must satisfy.  Only for text and number types.

validationDescription.name: validationDescription
validationDescription.description: A localised human readable description of the validation.

values.name: values
values.description: If only certain values are allowed they will be listed in this array.

optional.name: optional
optional.description: Most fields are required by default, but occasionally a part of a group is optional, e.g. address2 in an address group may be desirable to show, but optional from a validation perspective.

minLength.name: minLength
minLength.description: The minimum allowable length for string type fields.  If absent assume there is no minimum.

maxLength.name: maxLength
maxLength.description: The maximum allowable length for string type fields.  If absent assume there is no maximum.

displayMask.name: displayMask
displayMask.description: A sequence of characters and spacers for breaking up the single value into separate input elements.  The client may choose to implement this functionality or not.

default.name: default
default.description: A default value to be used during presentation.  This value must still be supplied if it is required, we will not automatically set the default on the backend.

image.name: image
image.description: The URL of an image which helps visualise the field.

field-required.notes:
Required verifications are pieces of information that we need added to the users profile to be able to create a transfer using their chosen quote (route, amount, payment method).  This may be additional information like a users address, or it may be a document that we need to prove the users identity.

REQUIRES FURTHER CONSIDERATION.

field-required-group.name: field-required-group

key.name: key
key.description: The key for this group of fields

alternatives.name: alternatives
alternatives.description: The keys of alternative groups that could be completed instead of this group.

name.name: name
name.description: A localised name for the group of fields

field-required-group.notes: A group of fields which must be added to the users profile.  Groups can have alternatives where one group OR the other may be supplied.

country.name: country

slug.name: slug
slug.description: A human readable identifier for the country

canSend.name: canSend
canSend.description: Can we send from this country?

canReceive.name: canReceive
canReceive.description: Can we receive in this country?

payInCurrencies.name: payInCurrencies
payInCurrencies.description: The currencies in which we can accept pay ins in this country.  List of iso4217 3-digit currency codes.

payOutCurrencies.name: payOutCurrencies
payOutCurrencies.description: The currencies in which we can pay out in this country.  List of iso4217 3-digit currency codes.

country.notes: A country resource contains meta data about countries.  The country object also describes if we are able to send and/or receive transfers originating in that country.

currency.name: currency

name.name: name
name.description: The localised name of the currency

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.description: The prefix used when displaying the currency

postfix.name: postfix
postfix.description: The postfix used when displaying the currency

delimeter.name: delimeter
delimeter.description: The delimeter used when displaying the currency

currency.notes: A currency resource contains meta data about currencies.

route.name: route

sourceCountry.name: sourceCountry
sourceCountry.description: The iso3166 2 digit code for the source country.

targetCountry.name: targetCountry
targetCountry.description: The iso3166 2 digit code for the target country.

default.name: default
default.description: Is this the default route for the current user.

typicalFeePercentage.name: typicalFeePercentage
typicalFeePercentage.description: The typical fee charges on this route.

typicalDuration.name: typicalDuration
typicalDuration.description: The typical duration of a transfer in hours

route.notes: Routes are specific country/currency corridors for which we can perform transfers.  Routes are not always available in both directions.

rate.name: rate

generated.name: generated
generated.description: The time at which this rate was generated

rate.notes:
Rate is a simple resource that gives the exchange rate between a source currency and a target currency.  Rates are not a commitment of any kind, the are simply information that can be shared with the end user and give no guarantee that a transfer will occur using this exact value.  

If a user is authenticated they may receive real-time market data, otherwise the data will tend to be delayed by 15 minutes, this allows us to meet our agreements with rate suppliers.

quote.name: quote

source.name: source
source.description: The source currency, iso4217 3-digit currency code.

target.name: target
target.description: The target currency, iso4217 3-digit currency code.

amountType.name: amountType
amountType.description: (Optional) Is it the amount for source currency or target currency?  Defaults to source.

rateTolerance.name: rateTolerance
rateTolerance.description: (Optional) The percentage movement before the quote would become invalid e.g. a value of 3 would mean the rate could deteriate by 3% until the quote became invalid and the transfer was paused.If the rate falls below this limit the quote would become invalid.  Default is 3%.

businessId.name: businessId
businessId.description: (Optional) If this quote is for a business supply the business id.  If you do not supply a business id you will not be able to create a transfer for business account using this quote.

fixedRate.name: fixedRate
fixedRate.description: If a fixed rate quote is available this will field will be present with the fixed rate.

fixedExpiry.name: fixedExpiry
fixedExpiry.description: The date and time that a fixed rate offer (if available) expires.  If payment is received after this time the variable rate will be used, assuming the rate is still above the minimumm, otherwise the quote will be invalidated and the transfer cancelled.

rateMin.name: rateMin
rateMin.description: If the rate moves below this value the quote will become invalid and any associated transfer will be cancelled.

quote.notes:
Quotes contain the rates and expiry criteria that we are our offering to the customer.  Quotes are used to create a transfer, based on that offer.  Depending on route, amount, or other factors, we may be to offer a fixed rate for a certain period of time, if payment is received in that time period we will perform the exchange at the fixed rate otherwise we will fall back to the mid market rate.

If the rate has fallen beyond a given amount (customisable, but 3% by default) the quote will become invalid and will cause the transfer to be cancelled and money returned.  

If the quote is going to be used to create a transfer for a business the businessId must be specified when creating the quote as businesses may receive different offers.

A quote is required to create a transfer.  Quotes may also contain an expiry time after which it will no longer be possible to use that quote when creating a transfer, or a set of rate bounds, if the rate moves outside of the bounds the quote would also become invalid.  Depending on situation the API client may elect to handle quote expiry transparently, generating a new quote if required without user input.

fee.name: fee

rate.name: rate
rate.description: Used where the fee is a percentage. 1% = 0.01

amount.name: amount
amount.description: The specific amount, either the fixed amount or result of applying the percentage to the overall amount.

description.name: description
description.description: A localised human readable reason why the fee will be applied.
description.example: TransferWise's fee for processing this transfer.

fee.notes: Information about a fee that may be applied during a transfer.  Fee may include the percentage charged by TransferWise, or a fee charged by a card processor, or other fees specific to that transfer type.

pay-in-method.name: pay-in-method

accountNumber.name: accountNumber
accountNumber.description: The account number to pay into

sortCode.name: sortCode
sortCode.description: The sort code to pay into

max.name: max
max.description: The max amount transferable using this method.

min.name: min
min.description: The min amount transferable using this method.

fees.name: fees
fees.description: A list of fees associated with this transfer type.

pay-in-method.notes: The method of payment being used to transfer funds.

role.name: role
role.description: Role assigned to user in a company

transfer-request.name: transfer-request

id.name: id
id.description: The id of the transfer request.

accountId.name: accountId
accountId.description: The account into which the user would like the money paid.

amount.name: amount
amount.description: The amount the user is requesting.

email.name: email
email.description: The email address of the person who should pay the money.

message.name: message
message.description: A message for the person who is being asked to pay.
message.example: Please can you pay me the 500 you owe me?

status.name: status
status.description: What is the status of the transfer?

due.name: due
due.description: The date on which the payment is due.

receivedAmount.name: receivedAmount
receivedAmount.description: How much money has the requestor received.

link.name: link
link.description: A link that could be shared with the paying user.

createdTime.name: createdTime
createdTime.description: The date on which this transfer request was created.

transfer-request.notes: A request for payment, mad by an existing TransferWise user.  The specified email address will be message to ask for payment, which will be setup as a regular transfer.  The currency

info.name: info
info.description: Key/value data about the business.  The required keys will be returned by the business-requirements end point.

country.name: country
country.description: The home country for this business, iso3166 2 digit country code.

number.name: number
number.description: The registered business number in the home country.

value-name.name: value-name

value.name: value
value.description: The systems identifier for this thing

name.name: name
name.description: A localised name for this thing.

value-name.notes: A combination of a value which acts an identifier, and a localised name which is human readable.

property-error.name: property-error

path.name: path
path.description: The path to property in supplied model.

message.name: message
message.description: A localised human readable error message describing the problem.
message.example: State: 'California' is not a compatible with country 'United Kingdom''

incomatibleWith.name: incomatibleWith
incomatibleWith.description: The path to a property this value was incompatible with.

property-error.notes: Description of an problem with a specific property.  The path indicates how to find the problematic property in the supplied JSON object.

responseHeaders.name: Content-Type
responseHeaders.description: The media type of the body

responseHeaders.name: Content-Length
responseHeaders.description: How many bytes the content body contains

responseHeaders.name: Content-Encoding
responseHeaders.description: What, if any, compression is being used.

responseHeaders.name: ETag
responseHeaders.description: A short string representation of the resource, useful for seeing if it has changed.

responseHeaders.name: Last-Modified
responseHeaders.description: When was the resource last modified

responseHeaders.name: Link
responseHeaders.description: Links to other pages of data in the collection, valid values are: first, prev, next, last

responseHeaders.name: X-Total-Count
responseHeaders.description: The number of items in the collection
